page.title: 14LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: {Cliveden}is a fine mansion house, in large grounds, which dominates over the {River Thames}at{Cliveden Deep,} giving magnificent views over the { {Cookham area. } There has been a house on the site since 1666. The present house was built in 1850 by Sir Charles Barry, after the previous building was destroyed by fire, and is acknowledged as a masterpiece. The extensive grounds include a {parterre, Long {Garden, Ilex Grove and Japanese Water {Garden}as well as open parkland and the{hanging woods,}on the steep escarpment above the river. The grounds also include many statues and pavilions and has an{Amphitheatre, where plays and concerts are regularly performed. {Cliveden}has had ten owners during it's history. In 1893 it was bought by
